title: KLONIE
content:
KLONIE (Clonia) was the Naiad-nymph of a spring or fountain of the town of Hyria in Boiotia (central Greece).
        She was the wife of Hyrieus, the eponymous founding-prince of the town, and the mother of Lykos (Lycus) and
        Nykteus (Nycteus), regents of the city of Thebes.

Klonie was probably identified with Kelaino (Celaeno), the mother of Lykos and
        Nykteus mentioned by other writers.

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 1. 49 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd A.D.)
          :
        "Hyrieus and a Nymphe named Klonie (Clonia) were parents of Nykteus (Nycteus) and Lykos (Lycus)."
